ðŸŒŸ phoenix | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Web development with a focus on JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, providing a lightweight and fun coding experience.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Web development focus (JS, HTML, CSS) â€¢ Game-like UX for code editing â€¢ Lightweight editor â€¢ Brackets extension compatibility â€¢ Local development experience
ðŸ“– Summary: Phoenix is a modern, open-source text editor designed for web development, emphasizing a game-like user experience to make coding more enjoyable. It supports Brackets extensions, offers a seamless local development environment, and is built to be lightweight and easily auditable. The editor prioritizes simplicity and ease of development, aiming to provide a fast and efficient coding experience.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ winhider | C++
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Hiding specific application windows from being visible during screen sharing sessions and from the taskbar/taskswitcher, while still allowing the user to interact with them.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Hides windows from screensharing â€¢ Hides windows from taskbar and taskswitcher (Alt-Tab) â€¢ GUI and CLI interface â€¢ DLL injection for hiding/unhiding windows
ðŸ“– Summary: WinHider is a C++ application that allows users to selectively hide windows from screensharing applications and the taskbar/taskswitcher. It provides both a GUI and CLI interface for managing window visibility, utilizing DLL injection to achieve its functionality.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ Addon | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automatically remove tracking elements from URLs to protect user privacy while browsing the internet.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Removes tracking from URLs automatically â€¢ Blocks some common ad domains (optional) â€¢ Built-in tool to clean up multiple URLs at once â€¢ Supports redirection without tracking services
ðŸ“– Summary: ClearURLs is a browser add-on that automatically removes tracking elements from URLs, enhancing user privacy. It supports multiple browsers and offers features like blocking ad domains, cleaning multiple URLs, and preventing various tracking methods. The add-on aims to provide a cleaner and more private browsing experience by eliminating unnecessary tracking parameters from web addresses.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ MORT | C#
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Real-time translation of game dialogs using OCR and machine translation or database lookups.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Realtime translate â€¢ OCR (TesseractOCR, Windows OCR, NHOcr, Easy OCR) â€¢ Machine translation (Naver Papago, Google Web, Google Sheet, ezTrans, DeepL) â€¢ Language Patch with using DB
ðŸ“– Summary: MORT is a real-time game translator that extracts dialog from the screen using OCR and provides translations via machine translation services or a database. It supports multiple OCR engines and translation providers, allowing users to customize the translation process. The program is designed to help users understand foreign language games by providing instant translations of in-game text.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ tftp-np-light | Batchfile
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Network booting of operating systems and utilities using PXE.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ PXE boot server â€¢ DHCP Proxy Mode support â€¢ HTTP file sharing via the 'files' directory â€¢ Customizable menu via menu.ejs â€¢ BIOS and UEFI support
ðŸ“– Summary: TFTP-NP is a PXE boot server that allows users to boot operating systems and utilities over a network. It supports both BIOS and UEFI systems and offers features like DHCP Proxy Mode, HTTP file sharing, and customizable menus. The server is configured through a config file or a web interface.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ frp | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Exposing local servers behind NAT or firewalls to the internet.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ TCP and UDP support â€¢ HTTP and HTTPS support â€¢ P2P connect mode â€¢ Configuration files â€¢ Environment variables
ðŸ“– Summary: frp is a fast reverse proxy that enables users to expose local servers, even those behind NAT or firewalls, to the internet. It supports various protocols like TCP, UDP, HTTP, and HTTPS, and offers features such as P2P connectivity, encryption, compression, and monitoring. frp simplifies the process of accessing internal services from external networks.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ jumpserver | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Providing DevOps and IT teams with on-demand and secure access to various endpoints.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Privileged Access Management (PAM) â€¢ Secure access to SSH, RDP, Kubernetes, Database, and RemoteApp endpoints â€¢ Web browser access â€¢ Bastion Host functionality
ðŸ“– Summary: JumpServer is an open-source Privileged Access Management (PAM) tool designed to provide DevOps and IT teams with secure, on-demand access to SSH, RDP, Kubernetes, Database, and RemoteApp endpoints. It acts as a bastion host, centralizing and securing access through a web browser, enhancing security and simplifying access management.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ shell-secrets | Shell
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Securely managing and accessing sensitive environment variables in shell scripts.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Encrypts environment variables using GPG. â€¢ Reads secret values from encrypted files. â€¢ Provides a login function to set environment variables. â€¢ Includes a logout function to unset environment variables. â€¢ Updates the SECRET_LOGIN environment variable for shell prompt customization.
ðŸ“– Summary: The shell-secrets repository provides a tool for managing environment variables by encrypting them with GPG. It allows users to securely store sensitive information in encrypted files and then easily load them into the environment using a simple login/logout mechanism. This helps prevent storing secrets in plain text shell files.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
